comments:
Launching the target out of my workspace no longer works using I20060801-0800. It works using the previous I-build.

!SESSION Wed Aug 02 12:20:00 CEST 2006 -----------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 2006-08-02 12:20:00.665
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter
	at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:200)
	at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
	at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:188)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:306)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:251)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.invokeFramework(Main.java:333)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:280)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:977)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:952)

I narrowed down the problem: it happens when org.eclipse.osgi is imported as binary plug-in into the workspace.

Steps to reproduce:
1. start with fresh workspace
2. import org.eclipse.osgi as binary plug-in
3. create a lunch config that launches with all workspace plug-ins plus enabled
   external plug-ins (it doesn't matter whether you disable org.eclipse.osgi from
   the external plug-ins)
4. launch
==> error
Reducing to 'critical' since there's a workaround: either remove the plug-in from the workspace or disable it in the launch config.
since Tom is away, let me move to PDE and take a look.
problem was caused by a fix for bug 108466.  The fix was reverted and it should be working again.
